description: Medical educator creates a SCORM e‑learning module from an uploaded anatomy PDF, receiving a ready‑to‑download package with interactive slides and labeling quiz items.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an AI assistant that helps educators turn source materials (PDFs, videos, etc.) into SCORM‑compatible interactive learning modules. Use the provided tools to upload files, extract text, identify key concepts, generate assessments, populate a SCORM template, validate the package and finally store it, returning a public download link to the user.
I have a PDF of anatomy diagrams for my medical students. I'd like a SCORM package with interactive slides that let them zoom into each diagram and a labeling quiz.
Got it! First, please upload the PDF file so I can process it.
Thanks! I’ll extract the plain‑text from the PDF.
Now I’ll identify the key anatomical concepts and potential slide titles.

arguments.text: Chapter 1: Skeletal System... Figure 1. Femur – label the head, neck, shaft, distal end. Figure 2. Skull – label the frontal bone, occipital bone, etc.

messages.content: {"concepts": ["Femur anatomy", "Skull bone landmarks", "Vertebral column", "Pelvis structure", "Shoulder girdle", "Hand bones", "Foot bones", "Joint articulations"]}
Great, I have a list of core concepts. I’ll fetch a linear SCORM template to build the module.
Now I’ll create a short‑answer labeling quiz based on the concepts.

{"questions": [{"type":"short_answer","prompt":"Label the four main parts of the femur.","answer":"head, neck, shaft, distal end"},{"type":"multiple_choice","prompt":"Which bone forms the forehead?","options":["Frontal bone","Parietal bone","Temporal bone","Occipital bone"],"answer":"Frontal bone"},{"type":"true_false","prompt":"The sacrum is part of the vertebral column.","answer":true},{"type":"short_answer","prompt":"Name the two bones that make up the pelvis.","answer":"Ilium and ischium"},{"type":"multiple_choice","prompt":"Which joint connects the humerus to the scapula?","options":["Shoulder (glenohumeral)","Elbow (humeroulnar)","Wrist (radiocarpal)","Knee (femorotibial)"],"answer":"Shoulder (glenohumeral)"},{"type":"short_answer","prompt":"List the three bones of the middle ear.","answer":"Malleus, incus, stapes"}]}
I’ll now populate the SCORM template with slides that include the diagrams (zoomable) and embed the quiz.

messages.content: I’ll now run the SCORM compliance validator on the generated package.
The package passed validation. I’ll store it permanently and give you a download link.

All set! Your SCORM‑compatible module "Human Anatomy – Skeletal System" is ready. You can download it here:

https://storage.example.com/modules/Human_Anatomy_Skeletal_System.zip

Upload the zip to any LMS (Moodle, Canvas, Blackboard, etc.) and your students will be able to view the interactive slides, zoom into each diagram, and complete the labeling quiz.

Let me know if you need any adjustments or another module created.
